## University of Washington

My Masters thesis investigated the interactive effects of air pollution and ambient temperature on mortality in Mexico City using generalized additive models. Full text provided upon request.

\vspace{4em}

## Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation

The below selected publications represent my contributions to the Global Burden of Disease study over 3 years.

Walker, K., …, **Godwin, W.**, Health Effects Institute & Global Burden of Disease Project Collaboration (2019). State of Global Air 2019-Special Report on Global Exposure to Air Pollution and its Disease Burden

Shupler, M., **Godwin, W.**, Frostad, J., Gustafson, P., Arku, R., Brauer, M (2018). Global estimation of exposure to fine particulate matter (PM 2.5) from household air pollution.

Gakidou, E., …, **Godwin, W. W.**, & GBD 2016 Risk Factors Collaborators (2017). Global, regional, and national comparative risk assessment of 84 behavioural, environmental and occupational, and metabolic risks or clusters of risks, 1990–2016: a systematic analysis for the Global Burden of Disease Study 2016.

Forouzanfar, M. H., …, **Godwin, W. W**., & GBD Collaborators (2016). Global, regional, and national comparative risk assessment of 79 behavioural, environmental and occupational, and metabolic risks or clusters of risks, 1990–2015: a systematic analysis for the Global Burden of Disease Study 2015.

Lim, S. S., …., **Godwin, W. W.**, & GBD 2015 SDG Collaborators (2016). Measuring the health-related Sustainable Development Goals in 188 countries: a baseline analysis from the Global Burden of Disease Study 2015.

Wang, H., …, **Godwin, W. W.**, & GBD 2015 Mortality and Causes of Death Collaborators (2016). Global, regional, and national life expectancy, all-cause mortality, and cause-specific mortality for 249 causes of death, 1980–2015: a systematic analysis for the Global Burden of Disease Study 2015.
